page.title: 17GATEACRE - ONCE A VILLAGE.
page.content: The area known as{Gateacre}has been inhabited for a very long time.The Domesday records make reference to the district of{Little Woolton}(Gateacre) as{Ulvetune.}It is not certain how or when the name Gateacre came into being. We do know that the{Anglo Saxons}had a settlement at Camp Hill in Woolton.The name could possibly be derived from the Middle English gate, meaning{"way" and the Anglo Saxon acre, meaning {"field".}Gateacre Brow,leading from the village crossroads,would have been the "way" to the grazing ground higher up,"the acre".It is also thought that the name came from the Anglo Saxon, {Gottesacker}or God's acre. The village remained very isolated until the end of the last century when Liverpool widened its boundary and we became part of the city in 1913.
